node.title: 'That could kill you': Terrifying footage shows surfboards flying off vehicle, almost hitting cars behind
node.description: The incident occurred on State Highway 1 in Northland on Wednesday.
node.content: ["A frightening video has emerged showing the scary moment two surfboards came flying off the back of a Range Rover in Northland, almost hitting two cars.", "The Range Rover was travelling south on State Highway 1 near Uretiti in Northland on January 5 when the surfboards came loose.", "Dashcam footage from a car behind the Range Rover captured the moment and the footage was uploaded to the Facebook group Motorway Community New Zealand.", "The footage shows the surfboards flying off the roof of the vehicle and forcing the car directly behind to swerve to avoid getting hit.", "The car's rearview dashcam caught one of the surfboards ending up on the opposite side of the road, putting incoming traffic at risk.", "The second surfboard then ended up in the centre of the southbound lane. forcing further cars behind to swerve to avoid them.", "One person commented on the video saying: \"god that could kill you people\" while another said: \"Damn fine reactions saved potentially fatal accident. Hopefully footage can be used to prosecute.\"", "A\u00a0Waka Kotahi spokesperson said it's important people\u00a0take the time to ensure that anything they are carrying on the roof is secure.\u00a0", "\"It\u2019s very important that people take the time to ensure that anything they are carrying on the roof of their vehicle, or in a trailer or on a rack, is properly and safely secured,\" the Waka Kotahi spokesperson said. ", "\"Any large or heavy object which comes loose from a vehicle travelling at speed on the road can became a dangerous missile or obstacle, putting other road users at risk.\u00a0", "\"It\u2019s also a legal requirement in New Zealand to\u00a0make sure any load you\u2019re carrying is secure and that it can\u2019t fall or escape from your vehicle or trailer. Any person loading the vehicle also has the same responsibility - not just the driver.", "\"You can be given a $600 infringement notice, or if you\u2019re prosecuted through the courts you can be fined up to $2,000 and disqualified for a period decided by the judge.\""]
